intro: Adonanthe distorta, commonly known as the twisted leaf fern, is a unique species native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, spirally twisted fronds that give it a striking appearance. The plant belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is known for its slow growth rate. Its leaves are typically dark green and can reach lengths of up to 1 meter. Adonanthe distorta thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
